meanings.definition: To remove the testicles of (a male animal or person)
meanings.sent1: The farmer was castrating the young bull to prevent breeding.
meanings.sent2: The veterinarian castrated the stray cat to control the population.
meanings.sent3: After castrating the rooster, he became the quietest bird in the coop.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter seemed to be castrating the trees of their leaves.
meanings.sent5: The ancient practice of castrating eunuchs was common in some cultures.

meanings.definition: To render impotent or deprive of vitality
meanings.sent1: The toxic relationship was slowly castrating his self-esteem.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's oppressive regime aimed at castrating the spirit of the people.
meanings.sent3: Her strict diet was castrating any joy she found in food.
meanings.sent4: The pessimistic outlook was castrating his hopes for a better future.
meanings.sent5: The negative comments were castrating her enthusiasm for the project.
